intro: Microcoelia defoliata, commonly known as the leafless microcoelia, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its reduced foliage, with most of its biomass concentrated in its stems and flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and evolution.
